column1: #Text=[0022] This process can also be extended to usage on a two dimensional image displayed on a stereoscopic display along with a two dimensional UI as depicted in FIG. 5.

#Text=In this case, as in the case of three dimensional content, the relative position of the two dimensional UI 120 can be placed at a position in the three dimensional illusion which is closer to the user than a two dimensional image 130.
#Text=While this depiction shows the two dimensional image 130 being in -ve depth and the UI being in the +ve depth, this is only to be considered illustrative.
#Text=This only consideration is that the UI be placed closer to the viewer in the illusion than the video image.

#Text=[0023] As a further example, it is possible for the UI to be represented as a three dimensional object as shown in FIG. 6 as UI 140 which has varying depth and which is positioned in front of the two dimensional image 130 displayed on the stereoscopic display panel 100.
#Text=It will be evident that one can also place a three dimensional UI such as 140 in front of a three dimensional image such as the image containing 104, 108 and 112.
#Text=[0024] To realize this solution, there should be knowledge of the depth of objects in the content.
#Text=There are at least two methods to acquire this depth information, but any suitable method is satisfactory for purposes of implementation of embodiments consistent with the present invention.
#Text=[0025] In accord with a first method, the depth information can be embedded as metadata with the data representing the three dimensional content.

#Text=In this case, the display system has merely to read the metadata (which can be a global range of depth, or may be on a scene by scene, segment by segment, or frame by frame basis) and select a depth value that is closer to the viewer than the closest object for positioning the UI.

#Text=[0026] In accord with a second method, a system is in place, which uses either a hardware or software based system, that analyzes the depth of the content, either in real time as the content is played or as an offline process to determine the depth of the content.
